Articles.Content:
I was looking at the KSP Wiki page on Kerbals. It said that they could sweat, but I had never seen one do that. Is this fact true?

Edited January 11, 2015 by Engineer Of Stuff

Not as far as I know

Edit: on another interesting note, the wiki says that their language (backwards Spanish) contains all sorts of sounds that are incredibly hard to pronounce. It said that kerbal larynxes would need to be an interesting structure to pronounce those sounds. This makes me wonder if their massive head is not a large brain, but a large and complex larynx.

Edited January 10, 2015 by Vectura
Perhaps it was taking some of the official videos in mind (Or maybe they do that for whatever reason in Kerbalizer, given it also uses that as a reference.)

Perhaps it was taking some of the official videos in mind (Or maybe they do that for whatever reason in Kerbalizer, given it also uses that as a reference.)

I think that I saw one sweating in a video. I'll check.

Found one, in the asteroid redirect mission video, about 0:55 (the kerbal in the ship). Barely visible, but there for sure (0:59) is very visible.

Of course, we're talking about creatures who build spaceships, speak something suspiciously similar to backwards spanish exclusively (but also write in english), and have an unusual attraction to shiny things. (Kerbol flavour text) and haven't yet established a planet-wide civilization (or invented ladders in early career, for that matter)

Maybe it's not best to get wrapped into this too much

It is said that he sweats rocket fuel and was born with a mischievous grin.

But we know him as....The Jeb!
How would you know, I don't think anybody has seen him sweat...
